Get UK Eurostat NUTS Boundaries

Source: R/get_sf.R
read_nuts.Rd

read_nuts downloads Eurostat NUTS Boundaries from the ONS Open Geography Portal.

read_nuts(
  geog,
  year = 2018,
  nations = c("E", "W", "S", "N"),
  type = "BGC",
  crs = 4326
)

Arguments

geog

NUTS Level 1, 2 or 3
year

Year (2015 or 2018)
nations

For which UK nations (c("E","W","S","N"))
type

Boundary Clipping

- "BFE": Full Resolution Extent of the Realm (Low Tide)

- "BFC": Full Resolution Clipped (High Tide)

- "BGC": Generalised (20m) Clipped (High Tide)

- "BUC": Ultra Generalised (500m) Clipped (High Tide)
crs

Coordinate Reference System (ESPG).

It is recommend to use 4326 (World Geodetic System) or potentially 27700 (UK OS British National Grid)

Value

Output is a simple feature object containing the relevant boundaries.

Details

Boundaries include:

- NUTS Level 1 (NUTS1)

- NUTS Level 2 (NUTS2)

- NUTS Level 3 (NUTS3)

Examples

read_nuts("NUTS1")
#> Simple feature collection with 12 features and 10 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -8.649996 ymin: 49.86474 xmax: 1.763571 ymax: 60.86078
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#> First 10 features:
#>    objectid  cd                       nm  bng_e  bng_n      long      lat
#> 1         1 UKC     North East (England) 417313 600358 -1.728900 55.29703

if (FALSE) {
read_nuts("NUTS2", nations = c("E"))
}
